@description.name: @description
@description.body: The qx.locale.Manager provides static translation methods (like tr()) and general locale information.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Translate a message

@param.name: @param
@param.body: messageId {String} message id (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {Object} variable number of arguments applied to the format string
@param.description: variable number of arguments applied to the format string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String | LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string
@return.description: The translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Translate a plural message Depending on the third argument the plural or the singular form is chosen.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: singularMessageId {String} message id of the singular form (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id of the singular form (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pluralMessageId {String} message id of the plural form (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id of the plural form (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: count {Integer} singular form if equals 1, otherwise plural
@param.description: singular form if equals 1, otherwise plural

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {Object} variable number of arguments applied to the format string
@param.description: variable number of arguments applied to the format string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String | LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string
@return.description: The translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Translate a message with translation hint (from developer addressed to translator).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: hint {String} hint for the translator of the message. Will be included in the .po file.
@param.description: hint for the translator of the message. Will be included in the .po file.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: messageId {String} message id (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {Object} variable number of arguments applied to the format string
@param.description: variable number of arguments applied to the format string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String | LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string
@return.description: The translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Translate a plural message with translation hint (from developer addressed to translator). Depending on the third argument the plural or the singular form is chosen.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: hint {String} hint for the translator of the message. Will be included in the .po file.
@param.description: hint for the translator of the message. Will be included in the .po file.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: singularMessageId {String} message id of the singular form (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id of the singular form (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pluralMessageId {String} message id of the plural form (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id of the plural form (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: count {Integer} singular form if equals 1, otherwise plural
@param.description: singular form if equals 1, otherwise plural

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {Object} variable number of arguments applied to the format string
@param.description: variable number of arguments applied to the format string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String | LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string
@return.description: The translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Mark the message for translation but return the original message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: messageId {String} the message ID
@param.description: the message ID

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} messageId
@return.description: messageId

@description.name: @description
@description.body: current locale. locale is an language code like de, deAT, en, enGB, fr, â€¦

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The owning object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: {String} The ID of the object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the language code of the current locale This is the first part of a locale definition. The language for "de_DE" would be "de"

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} language code
@return.description: language code

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the territory code of the current locale This is the second part of a locale definition. The territory for "de_DE" would be "DE"

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} territory code
@return.description: territory code

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the available application locales This corresponds to the LOCALES setting in config.json. Without argument, it only returns the currently loaded locales, with an argument of true all locales that went into the build. This is particularly interesting if locales were generated as dedicated I18N parts, and have to be loaded explicitly before being available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: includeNonloaded {Boolean?null} include locales not yet loaded
@param.description: include locales not yet loaded

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String[]} array of available locales
@return.description: array of available locales

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Extract the language part from a locale.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String} locale to be used
@param.description: locale to be used

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} language
@return.description: language

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add a translation to the translation manager. If languageCode already exists, its map will be updated with translationMap (new keys will be added, existing keys will be overwritten).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: languageCode {String} language code of the translation like de, de_AT, en, en_GB, fr, ...
@param.description: language code of the translation like de, de_AT, en, en_GB, fr, ...

@param.name: @param
@param.body: translationMap {Map} mapping of message identifiers to message strings in the target language, e.g. {"greeting_short" : "Hello"}. Plural forms are separate keys.
@param.description: mapping of message identifiers to message strings in the target language, e.g. {"greeting_short" : "Hello"}. Plural forms are separate keys.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add a localization to the localization manager. If localeCode already exists, its map will be updated with localeMap (new keys will be added, existing keys will be overwritten).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: localeCode {String} locale code of the translation like de, de_AT, en, en_GB, fr, ...
@param.description: locale code of the translation like de, de_AT, en, en_GB, fr, ...

@param.name: @param
@param.body: localeMap {Map} mapping of locale keys to the target locale values, e.g. {"cldr_date_format_short" : "M/d/yy"}.
@param.description: mapping of locale keys to the target locale values, e.g. {"cldr_date_format_short" : "M/d/yy"}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Translate a message using the current locale and apply format string to the arguments. Implements the lookup chain locale (e.g. en_US) -> language (e.g. en) -> default locale (e.g. C). Localizes the arguments if possible and splices them into the message. If qx.dynlocale is on, returns a {@link LocalizedString}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: messageId {String} message id (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: args {Object[]} array of objects, which are inserted into the format string
@param.description: array of objects, which are inserted into the format string

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String ? #locale} locale to be used; if not given, defaults to the value of {@link #locale}
@param.description: locale to be used; if not given, defaults to the value of {@link #locale}

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String | LocalizedString} translated message or localized string
@return.description: translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Provide localization (CLDR) data. Implements the lookup chain locale (e.g. en_US) -> language (e.g. en) -> default locale (e.g. C). Localizes the arguments if possible and splices them into the message. If qx.dynlocale is on, returns a {@link LocalizedString}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: messageId {String} message id (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: args {Object[]} array of objects, which are inserted into the format string
@param.description: array of objects, which are inserted into the format string

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String ? #locale} locale to be used; if not given, defaults to the value of {@link #locale}
@param.description: locale to be used; if not given, defaults to the value of {@link #locale}

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String | LocalizedString} translated message or localized string
@return.description: translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Look up an I18N key in a catalog and expand format strings. Implements the lookup chain locale (e.g. en_US) -> language (e.g. en) -> default locale (e.g. C). Localizes the arguments if possible and splices them into the message. If qx.dynlocale is on, returns a {@link LocalizedString}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: catalog {Map} map of I18N keys and their values
@param.description: map of I18N keys and their values

@param.name: @param
@param.body: messageId {String} message id (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: args {Object[]} array of objects, which are inserted into the format string
@param.description: array of objects, which are inserted into the format string

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String ? #locale} locale to be used; if not given, defaults to the value of {@link #locale}
@param.description: locale to be used; if not given, defaults to the value of {@link #locale}

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String | LocalizedString} translated message or localized string
@return.description: translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The bind method delegates the call to the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} function. As source, the current object (this) will be used.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
sourcePropertyChain {String} The property chain which represents
   the source property.
@param.description:
The property chain which represents
   the source property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
targetObject {qx.core.Object} The object which the source should
   be bind to.
@param.description:
The object which the source should
   be bind to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: targetProperty {String} The property name of the target object.
@param.description: The property name of the target object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
options {Map?null} A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
   information.
@param.description:
A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
   information.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{var} Returns the internal id for that binding. This can be used
   for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not an atomic
   id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.
@return.description:
Returns the internal id for that binding. This can be used
   for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not an atomic
   id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).
@throws.description:
If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The bind method delegates the call to the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} function. As source, the current object (this) will be used.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
sourcePropertyChain {String} The property chain which represents
   the source property.
@param.description:
The property chain which represents
   the source property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
targetObject {qx.core.Object} The object which the source should
   be bind to.
@param.description:
The object which the source should
   be bind to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: targetProperty {String} The property name of the target object.
@param.description: The property name of the target object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
options {Map} A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
   information.
@param.description:
A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
   information.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} A promise which is resolved when the initial value
 	 has been set on the target.  Note that this does NOT resolve when subsequent
   values are returned.  The promise value is the internal id for that binding.
   The id can be used for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not
   an atomic id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.
@return.description:
A promise which is resolved when the initial value
 	 has been set on the target.  Note that this does NOT resolve when subsequent
   values are returned.  The promise value is the internal id for that binding.
   The id can be used for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not
   an atomic id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).
@throws.description:
If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes the binding with the given id from the current object. The id has to be the id returned by any of the bind functions.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {var} The id of the binding.
@param.description: The id of the binding.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the binding could not be found.
@throws.description: If the binding could not be found.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes all bindings between the object and the related one.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
relatedObject {qx.core.Object} The object of which related
   bindings should be removed.
@param.description:
The object of which related
   bindings should be removed.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.
@throws.description:
If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes all bindings from the object.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the object is not in the internal
   registry of the bindings.
@throws.description:
If the object is not in the internal
   registry of the bindings.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.
@throws.description:
If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array which lists all bindings for the object.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array} An array of binding informations. Every binding
   information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
   targetObject and targetProperty in that order.
@return.description:
An array of binding informations. Every binding
   information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
   targetObject and targetProperty in that order.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs a debug message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an info message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs a warning message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an error message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an error message with the current stack trace

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper that calls the appropriate logger function with the current object and any number of items.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: level {String} The log level of the message
@param.description: The log level of the message

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {arguments} Arguments list to be logged
@param.description: Arguments list to be logged

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add event listener to this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
self {Object ? null} Reference to the 'this' variable inside
         the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
         usually falls back to a default, which is the target
         by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
         custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.
@param.description:
Reference to the 'this' variable inside
         the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
         usually falls back to a default, which is the target
         by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
         custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.description:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add event listener to this object, which is only called once. After the listener is called the event listener gets removed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object ? window} reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback
@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.description:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove event listener from this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: self {Object ? null} reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback
@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean} Whether to remove the event listener of
   the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to remove the event listener of
   the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)
@return.description: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes an event listener from an event target by an id returned by {@link #addListener}

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} The id returned by {@link #addListener}
@param.description: The id returned by {@link #addListener}

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)
@return.description: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Check if there are one or more listeners for an event type.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to check for listeners of
         the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to check for listeners of
         the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the object has a listener of the given type.
@return.description: Whether the object has a listener of the given type.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Dispatch an event on this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: evt {qx.event.type.Event} event to dispatch
@param.description: event to dispatch

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean|qx.Promise} whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create an event object and dispatch it on this object. The event dispatched with this method does never bubble! Use only if you are sure that bubbling is not required.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an non-bubbling data event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {var} User defined data attached to the event object
@param.description: User defined data attached to the event object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: oldData {var?null} The event's old data (optional)
@param.description: The event's old data (optional)

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cancelable {Boolean?false} Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}
@param.description:
Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean|qx.Promise} whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets multiple properties at once by using a property list or sets one property and its value by the first and second argument. As a fallback, if no generated property setter could be found, a handwritten setter will be searched and invoked if available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {Map | String} a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.
@param.description: a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {var?} the value, only used when data is a string.
@param.description: the value, only used when data is a string.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Object} Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.
@return.description: Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist
@throws.description: if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the value of the given property. If no generated getter could be found, a fallback tries to access a handwritten getter.

@param.description: Name of the property.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The value of the value
@return.description: The value of the value

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist
@throws.description: if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the value of the given property. If no generated resetter could be found, a handwritten resetter will be invoked, if available.

@param.description: Name of the property.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist
@throws.description: if a property defined does not exist

@return.name: @return

@return.description: If the property is initialized

@throws.name: @throws

@throws.description: If the property defined does not exist

id

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the object and adds it to a list; most classes are expected to override _createQxObjectImpl NOT this method.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} ID of the object
@param.description: ID of the object

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.core.Object?} the created object
@return.description: the created object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the object, intended to be overridden. Null is a valid return value and will be cached by getQxObject, however undefined is NOT a valid value and so will not be cached meaning that _createQxObjectImpl will be called multiple times until a valid value is returned.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} ID of the object
@param.description: ID of the object

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.core.Object?} the created object
@return.description: the created object

@description.name: @description

@param.description: the object to register

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String?} the id to set when registering the object
@param.description: the id to set when registering the object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Discards an object from the list of owned objects; note that this does not dispose of the object, simply forgets it if it exists.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: args {String|Object} the ID of the object to discard, or the object itself
@param.description: the ID of the object to discard, or the object itself

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes an owned object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: obj {qx.core.Object} the object
@param.description: the object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array of objects that are owned by this object, or an empty array if none exists.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Array}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.
